Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Thoracic Endovascular Aortic Repair (TEVAR) for Vertebral Erosion

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients with a history of TEVAR and symptoms of vertebral erosion. Eligibility criteria included age over 18 and confirmed vertebral erosion.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received posterior instrumented fusion and TEVAR, while the control group received standard care.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the reduction in vertebral erosion, measured over a 3-month period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the intervention and 100 to the control group, between January 2020 and June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group had a mean reduction of 5.2 mm (95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
